Building a Raspberry Pi Radio Station

Overview

This project involves creating a low-power radio station using a Raspberry Pi and a simple FM transmitter. The station broadcasts music and announcements within a small radius, perfect for school events or local community use.

Hardware Requirements

  • Raspberry Pi (any model)
  • FM transmitter module
  • Antenna (simple wire works)
  • Power supply
  • Audio source (USB sound card or GPIO)

Software Setup

The station runs on a custom Python script that manages the audio playback and transmission:

import RPi.GPIO as GPIO
import time
import subprocess

# Initialize GPIO
GPIO.setmode(GPIO.BCM)
GPIO.setup(18, GPIO.OUT)

def play_audio(file_path):
    subprocess.run(['aplay', file_path])

def main():
    while True:
        # Play music
        play_audio('music.wav')
        # Play announcement
        play_audio('announcement.wav')
        time.sleep(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Features

  • Automated playlist management
  • Scheduled announcements
  • Low power consumption
  • Easy to set up and maintain

Future Improvements

  1. Web interface for remote control
  2. Multiple channel support
  3. Live streaming capability
  4. Emergency broadcast system

Conclusion

This project demonstrates how simple hardware can be used to create interesting and useful applications. The radio station has been successfully used at several school events and community gatherings.
